intro: Erysimum australe var. baldaccii, commonly known as the baldacccii wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
